ways to fix writer's block
- try turning the author on and off again
- let them talk, they might talk themselves out of their own mess
- if they're crying, put them in a bag of rice
- say "give up then" in a comforting way and watch them get back to work out of sheer spite

tweet:
helpful tips to fix your plot holes
- lean back and squint at your writing until the problems go blurry
- just backspace that bit
- explode something so the reader looks at that instead of the hole
- have one character say "life doesn't make sense!!" and now you're covered

tweet:
how to write an outline
- brain dump every cool thing that could happen in your book
- rearrange it so it mostly fits a 3-act structure
- meticulously fill in plot holes
- feel professional for 2.4 seconds
- gently lower your characters into the outline
- watch them burn it down

writer question time! do you plot and write your books chronologically?

tweet:
I barely ever see disability books on bestseller lists, or on diverse rec lists, or hyped up. Quite frankly, the most famous disabled books are written by abled authors. And often it's harmful rep.

Reviews still call disabled characters: needy, whiny, immature and - unrelatable.

- hurts your book's feelings
- boring

- reminder that drafts exist to change and improve
- indicates if you shake it glitter will fill the plot holes

- soft trash raccoon
- this fool i am trying to work with
- my murder kids
- unquestionable queen could stab me if she wants
- little onion
- who i'd be if i was cooler so basically nothing like me

things writers do before starting to write
- write a very good outline to ignore later
- check twitter
- fondly reread yesterday's work

- do a little snacking
- tell twitter they're writing
- change fonts
- wild self doubt
- write

tweet:
how to enjoy books correctly
- read them
- borrow them
- take photos of them
- sit amongst piles of unread books if it comforts you
- reread your favourites
- annotate or break spines or hug fiercely
- keep them pristine
- maybe just, hear me out, enjoy books however you want

- platonic napping together

- they stare vaguely at you while you're talking because they're daydreaming

reasons to write books
- it's like reading a story (just more painful)
- it's a way to talk for like 9 hours without being interrupted
- because your story is fiercely important!
- you can get the books you WANT to read

how to be a bookworm
- have many many books on your TBR pile
- approximately a million will do
- okay now the only book you feel like reading isn't out yet so therefore you have nothing to read

- sigh
- buy another book
- good job you are a bookworm

if you find a writer crying, try this:
- pet them softly
- feed them cheesy bread
- listen while they talk through their writing problems
- don't be dismissive!
- writing is tough and sometimes they just need to be heard
- eat that cheesy bread while they talk
- you both prosper

how to finish writing your book
- prioritise it
- make manageable daily goals
- make eye contact to assert dominance
- ah, i see it has just now beaten you up in a dark alley
- new plan! make a sticker chart to distract it
- write fast. give it a sticker for cooperation
- prosper

saying "I'm writing a book"
- cliche

- people ask what it's about and you forget your plot

- hardcore
- authoritative
- hints that you own a sword
- people stop talking to you which is, quite frankly, helpful

how to tell if a writer is working
- they are huddled over their laptop, stabbing keys and hissing

- they're on twitter
